@syncros Try again after the first tweet and it reverts back. Clearly a bug. Twitter @support impossible to reach. https://t.co/5sJAWr17b8
@syncros This is Twitter's own client. If you log out of your account and back in, images don't count towards 140 https://t.co/ka4n298O03
@Twitter @Support After logging out and back in image doesn't count towards 140. But only for the first tweet. https://t.co/PmgZDoietf
@Twitter @Support Image character count is still broken for me. ðŸ˜©It's a #bug. I'm on 6.71.1. Can you DM me please? https://t.co/gocTygftab
Does this work as announced for anybody? My attached images still deduct from 140 characters. https://t.co/EpRPuqem1f
@Support I can't get any help on this. I've deleted/reinstalled the app. The bug persists. #PleaseHelp https://t.co/fQ5b3FvrqC
@Support Bug: attach an image. It uses up characters. Log out and back in. Image no longer counts towards 140. Next one does again.
@Square Example: John Doe handles payments at ACME Co. When I issue an invoice, it has John Doe's name on it, not Aâ€¦ https://t.co/PYEdd9Dd1b
@Square This has forced me to make a workaround putting the company's name in the First and Last Name fields. Am I missing something?
@Square When issuing an invoice, it shows the recipient's name on the invoice. I want to invoice a company, not someone who works there.
@bunztradingzone Still on schedule for this week? Knowing a new app is coming helps endure through the crashes.
@daringfireball Apple won't need to rely on others for displays. The Mac and Mac Pro will already have beautiful 5K displays.
@daringfireball The "i" is for iOS hardware. I expect a Mac lineup reorganization and nomenclature adjustment: https://t.co/rcuZuRR8c7
@daringfireball MacBookPros connect via Thunderbolt to new all-in-one Mac and Mac Pro to distribute resources and use larger screen.
@daringfireball New iMac becomes "Mac". New Mac Pro, an all in one with pro components. Macs linkable for distributed power, screen sharing.
@daringfireball Apple not expecting to rely on 3rd party displays because soon there won't be any headless Macs. https://t.co/pBqNgEvTss
@culturedcode Logged out of all devices and back in. Even deleted/reinstall. Sync is *definitely* broken. Cloud status site says all fine.
@culturedcode Has there been a problem with Things Cloud? Sync now takes minutes to reflect changes, some items don't sync at all.
@iMore Trackpad all the way. Hoping for the Magic Trackpad 3 to do this. https://t.co/Mm85vBmThp
Mac is in for a lineup reorganization and nomenclature adjustment: Mac (former iMac) MacPro (all in one w/pro components) MacBook MacBookPro
Thoughts on the Mac: When Apple killed the standalone displays they showed their hand: the headless MacMini and MacPro are on their way out.

@asktimothybuck @rosnow Siri is too slow for routine playback and volume controls. Moving those controls to the wrist work perfectly.
@asktimothybuck @rosnow I'd go as far as to only recommend AirPods to people who also own an ï£¿WATCH. It replaces inline countrols nicely.
@rosnow @asktimothybuck Besides aesthetics, AirPods will not be for everybody. They don't fit in all types of ears. There are other options.
@rosnow @asktimothybuck How long have you been satisfied with Apple's wired earphones and later EarPods? They have never come in black.
@rosnow @asktimothybuck I can't remember the last time I longed to use wired headphones. I use AirPods on the go, AirPlay at home.
@asktimothybuck @rosnow Exactly. I missed Firewire for a bit. All my HDDs needed adapters. Now I love that one port connects everything.
@rosnow @asktimothybuck You didn't care enough to not buy the iPhone 7. The future (and the present) of audio is wirelss.

@TdotRome I don't know about needing a house. There are at least 7 Teslas (including a Model X) parked and charging in my condo's garage.

@TdotRome You might be out of the loop then. The affordable Tesla model 3 will change everything. Others like VW releasing cheap electrics.
@kemosite I didn't say that the revenue would be zero, only that it will have begun declining. 4Â¢ in 2021 might bring in the same as 2Â¢ now.
@TdotRome The point being, a bigger share of the gas tax would be useful this year. By 2021, the returns will have begun declining.
@TdotRome By 2020, internal combustion engine car sales will have begun a rapid decline in favour of electrics.
